articles.snippet: Will Wade was suspended on Friday after a report that he made damning remarks to a recruiting middleman on a wiretapped call in a federal corruption inquiry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Louisiana State suspended its head men’s basketball coach, Will Wade, on Friday — less than two weeks before the N.C.A.A. tournament is set to begin — after a report that Wade made damning remarks to a recruiting middleman on a phone call that was wiretapped as part of a federal corruption investigation.
articles.abstract: Will Wade was suspended on Friday after a report that he made damning remarks to a recruiting middleman on a wiretapped call in a federal corruption inquiry.

headline.main: L.S.U. Suspends Coach Over Reported Connection to Scandal
headline.print_headline: L.S.U. Coach, Tied to Scandal, Is Suspended

articles.snippet: The Rating Percentage Index, long the measuring stick for the N.C.A.A. basketball tournament, gives way to a new metric: the NET.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Kansas Jayhawks entered the postseason with their wings clipped. Having lost two stars midseason — one to an N.C.A.A. suspension, one to unspecified “personal matters” — they could well sustain double-digit losses for only the second time in 19 seasons.
articles.abstract: The Rating Percentage Index, long the measuring stick for the N.C.A.A. basketball tournament, gives way to a new metric: the NET.

headline.main: R.I.P. to the R.P.I.: Selection Committee Breaks Out New Math
headline.print_headline: Committee’s New Math Bids R.I.P. to the R.P.I.

articles.snippet: The Blue Devils, Virginia and North Carolina received top seeds in a triumph for the Atlantic Coast Conference. Gonzaga was the fourth No. 1 seed.
articles.lead_paragraph: Duke was given the No. 1 overall seed in the N.C.A.A. Division I men’s basketball tournament Sunday night, starting Coach Mike Krzyzewski and his star freshman Zion Williamson on a path to what they hope will be the Blue Devils’ sixth national title.
articles.abstract: The Blue Devils, Virginia and North Carolina received top seeds in a triumph for the Atlantic Coast Conference. Gonzaga was the fourth No. 1 seed.

headline.main: N.C.A.A. Tournament: Duke and the A.C.C. Rule the Bracket
headline.print_headline: Duke Takes Top Spot as A.C.C. Rules the Bracket

articles.snippet: The Jayhawks’ 14-year run of Big 12 championships ended this season, but a depleted roster is a bigger concern as the N.C.A.A. tournament opens.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAWRENCE, Kan. — The 14-year run of Big 12 basketball championships ended two weeks ago, when Kansas’s crown passed to Texas Tech and Kansas State. A yearlong reign as conference tournament champions came to a close last weekend, with the Jayhawks beaten by Iowa State in the final.
articles.abstract: The Jayhawks’ 14-year run of Big 12 championships ended this season, but a depleted roster is a bigger concern as the N.C.A.A. tournament opens.

headline.main: At Kansas, a No. 4 Seed Just Doesn’t Feel the Same
headline.print_headline: For Kansas, a Season of Actual Trials and Tribulations

articles.snippet: Live scores, updates and analysis from Day 1 of the N.C.A.A. basketball tournament.
articles.lead_paragraph: The higher seeds had a good day and the blueboods — Kentucky and Kansas — won big, but on the first day of the N.C.A.A. tournament, no one won bigger than Gonzaga.
articles.abstract: Live scores, updates and analysis from Day 1 of the N.C.A.A. basketball tournament.

headline.main: N.C.A.A. Tournament Day 1: Gonzaga, Kentucky and Kansas Cruise as Higher Seeds Avoid Trouble

byline.original: By Marc Tracy, Billy Witz and Pat Borzi

articles.snippet: The perceived slight of UConn’s seeding should give the Huskies plenty of motivation as they try to win their first national title since 2016.
articles.lead_paragraph: Amid the annual discussion of whether a dynasty is good or bad for women’s college basketball, Connecticut’s No. 2 seeding in the N.C.A.A. tournament qualifies as a sign of parity. With four No. 1 seeds — Baylor, Notre Dame, Louisville and Mississippi State — and three No. 2 seeds — UConn, Stanford and Oregon — that are strong contenders for the national title, the tournament appears to be more open than in the past.
articles.abstract: The perceived slight of UConn’s seeding should give the Huskies plenty of motivation as they try to win their first national title since 2016.

headline.main: Parity in Women’s Tournament Puts UConn in a Weird Position: No. 2
headline.print_headline: Women’s Parity Puts Connecticut in a Weird Position: No. 2

articles.snippet: Who will win the N.C.A.A. college basketball tournament? Will you fill out a bracket?
articles.lead_paragraph: Are you ready for March Madness?
articles.abstract: Who will win the N.C.A.A. college basketball tournament? Will you fill out a bracket?

headline.main: Do You Participate in March Madness?

articles.snippet: Fairleigh Dickinson advanced out of the First Four by beating Prairie View A&M, 82-76.
articles.lead_paragraph: DAYTON, Ohio — Darnell Edge scored a career-high 33 points, and Fairleigh Dickinson rallied to win its first ever N.C.A.A. Tournament game, taking down Prairie View A&M, 82-76, in the tournament opener Tuesday night.
articles.abstract: Fairleigh Dickinson advanced out of the First Four by beating Prairie View A&M, 82-76.

headline.main: Fairleigh Dickinson Gets Its First Win in the N.C.A.A. Men’s Basketball Tournament
headline.print_headline: First Victory For Dickinson In N.C.A.A.

articles.snippet: Louisiana State beat Maryland on a last-second shot, and Kentucky handed Wofford its first loss in 22 games. Ja Morant scored 28 in Murray State’s loss, and Villanova, the defending champion, fell.
articles.lead_paragraph: One of the oldest adages about college basketball is that guard play is the key to tournament success. Amid the intensity and mayhem that unfold each March, it is often the most composed, savvy and talented guards who determine the fates of their teams. But not always.
articles.abstract: Louisiana State beat Maryland on a last-second shot, and Kentucky handed Wofford its first loss in 22 games. Ja Morant scored 28 in Murray State’s loss, and Villanova, the defending champion, fell.

headline.main: N.C.A.A. Tournament Day 3: Kentucky and L.S.U. Head to Round of 16
headline.print_headline: A Tale of Three Guards, of Varying Outcomes

byline.original: By David Waldstein and Ben Shpigel

articles.snippet: Live scores, updates and analysis from Day 2 of the N.C.A.A. basketball tournament.
articles.lead_paragraph: Duke, Virginia and North Carolina — three No. 1 seeds from the Atlantic Coast Conference — opened the N.C.A.A. tournament with victories on Friday, but not before each one survived a scare.
articles.abstract: Live scores, updates and analysis from Day 2 of the N.C.A.A. basketball tournament.

headline.main: N.C.A.A. Tournament Day 2: Duke, Virginia and U.N.C. Stumble, Then Stroll

byline.original: By Ben Shpigel and David Waldstein

articles.snippet: The Irish began the defense of their national championship at home on Day 2 of the tournament.
articles.lead_paragraph: Arike Ogunbowale scored 23 points and Jessica Shepard had a double-double as Notre Dame, the No. 1 seed in the Chicago Region, began defense of its N.C.A.A. women’s basketball championship with a 92-50 victory over Bethune-Cookman at home in South Bend, Ind.
articles.abstract: The Irish began the defense of their national championship at home on Day 2 of the tournament.

headline.main: N.C.A.A. Women’s Tournament: Notre Dame and Maryland Romp. Princeton Is Out.
headline.print_headline: Missouri St. Stuns DePaul; Oregon St. Needs Overtime to Survive Scare

articles.snippet: A roundup of the scores and highlights. It was more than Ja Morant’s breakout performance.
articles.lead_paragraph: Here is who won on the first day (and night) of the N.C.A.A.’s men’s basketball tournament.
articles.abstract: A roundup of the scores and highlights. It was more than Ja Morant’s breakout performance.

headline.main: Who Won Last Night’s N.C.A.A. Tournament Games

articles.snippet: Another No. 2 seed, Iowa, avoided giving up a first-ever win for a No. 15 seed, and top-seeded Louisville romped without its coach or point guard.
articles.lead_paragraph: The N.C.A.A. women’s basketball tournament began on Friday with a romp by a team not used to being a mere No. 2 seed, and a scare for a No. 2 seed that almost yielded the first-ever victory for a No. 15 seed.
articles.abstract: Another No. 2 seed, Iowa, avoided giving up a first-ever win for a No. 15 seed, and top-seeded Louisville romped without its coach or point guard.

headline.main: N.C.A.A. Women’s Tournament: UConn, Just a No. 2 Seed, Rolls
headline.print_headline: UConn Cruises to a Win As Iowa Avoids an Upset

articles.snippet: Fans who follow college basketball closely know about the game’s intractable relationship to corruption. But turn away from the big party every March? That’s a tough ask.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jack Bowen is an author of a book on sports and ethics, and teaches high school courses on ethics and philosophy. When it came time to fill out a bracket for the N.C.A.A. men’s basketball tournament for a pool at work this year, he did not feel right about it.
articles.abstract: Fans who follow college basketball closely know about the game’s intractable relationship to corruption. But turn away from the big party every March? That’s a tough ask.

headline.main: March Madness’s Toughest Matchup: Brackets vs. Ethics
headline.print_headline: March’s Toughest Matchup: Brackets vs. Ethics

articles.snippet: The No. 1-seeded Zags, who lost to the Seminoles in last year’s round of 16, allowed a lead to shrink to 4 points before winning to advance to the West Region final.
articles.lead_paragraph: ANAHEIM, Calif. — The sweat had not yet dried on the brows of Gonzaga’s basketball players after they dispatched Baylor last weekend, but their gaze turned quickly to what lay ahead — a chance to rewrite last season’s ending.
articles.abstract: The No. 1-seeded Zags, who lost to the Seminoles in last year’s round of 16, allowed a lead to shrink to 4 points before winning to advance to the West Region final.

headline.main: Gonzaga Resists Florida State’s Rugged Play to Get N.C.A.A. Tournament Revenge
headline.print_headline: To Get Revenge, Gonzaga Resists Florida State’s Rugged Play

articles.snippet: A disappointing first week of the N.C.A.A. tournament yielded a compelling set of regional finals. The Final Four might be just as good.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The first games of last year’s N.C.A.A. men’s basketball tournament made plenty of memories: Virginia’s historic first-round exit; the beginning of Loyola-Chicago’s fun Final Four run; Nevada’s exciting upset of second-seeded Cincinnati.
articles.abstract: A disappointing first week of the N.C.A.A. tournament yielded a compelling set of regional finals. The Final Four might be just as good.

headline.main: Final Four Preview: A Weekend of Classics, and the Promise of More

articles.snippet: A top seed, a past champion and two first-time visitors will play for the national title this weekend.
articles.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS — Virginia, the only top seed remaining, will face Auburn, which is making its first appearance in the Final Four, in the first of two national semifinals of the N.C.A.A. men’s basketball tournament on Saturday. Michigan State, the 2000 champion, plays the newcomer Texas Tech in the second game.
articles.abstract: A top seed, a past champion and two first-time visitors will play for the national title this weekend.

headline.main: N.C.A.A. Men’s Final Four Preview
headline.print_headline: Men’s Final Four Preview: Top Seed and Past Champion Face 2 Newcomers

articles.snippet: Inglese led Boston College to seven N.C.A.A. tournament appearances and Vermont to consecutive undefeated seasons in her 27 years as a head coach.
articles.lead_paragraph: Cathy Inglese, a longtime women’s basketball head coach who led Boston College to seven N.C.A.A. tournament appearances and Vermont to consecutive undefeated regular seasons, died on Wednesday. She was 60.
articles.abstract: Inglese led Boston College to seven N.C.A.A. tournament appearances and Vermont to consecutive undefeated seasons in her 27 years as a head coach.

headline.main: Cathy Inglese, Winning Coach in Women’s Basketball, Dies at 60
headline.print_headline: Cathy Inglese, 60, Top Coach Of Boston College Basketball

articles.abstract: U.C.L.A. and Arizona appear to be strong again for a conference that put only three teams in each of the past two N.C.A.A. tournaments.
articles.snippet: U.C.L.A. and Arizona appear to be strong again for a conference that put only three teams in each of the past two N.C.A.A. tournaments.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Pac-12 Conference is off to a quick start in its bid to turn around its disappointing showing the past two seasons in men’s college basketball, positioning itself for more teams and potentially more wins in the 2020 N.C.A.A. tournament.

headline.main: There are Eight Undefeated Pac-12 Basketball Teams. Really.
headline.print_headline: The Pac-12, of All Conferences, Gets Off to a Fast Start

articles.abstract: Teams are looking for good nonconference games in November and December so when N.C.A.A. tournament selection time comes, they can say they deserve to be in.
articles.snippet: Teams are looking for good nonconference games in November and December so when N.C.A.A. tournament selection time comes, they can say they deserve to be in.
articles.lead_paragraph: The holiday season has felt a lot like the N.C.A.A. tournament for the Cincinnati men’s basketball team. That’s by design, a maneuver it hopes will pay off in March, when tournament seedings are made.

headline.main: College Teams Tout Stars. They Need Early Matchups to Brag About, Too.
headline.print_headline: Success Isn’t Just Wins, It’s Also Whom You Play
